fullText: Summer has its moments of genuine power, particularly when it focuses on the civil rights struggles that shaped Summer's worldview and when it showcases the undeniable force of her music.
dtliExcerpt: Summer has its moments of genuine power, particularly when it focuses on the civil rights struggles that shaped Summer's worldview and when it showcases the undeniable force of her music.
bwwExcerpt: Heaven knows what the creators of Summer are thinking, if any thought at all has gone into this disco dud of a show. Three talented and blameless women-LaChanze, Ariana DeBose and Storm Lever-play the late Donna Summer at different stages of her life in a tacky, sub-Vegas jukebox biomusical that draws from the singer's groovy catalog of hits, including "I Feel Love," "MacArthur Park," "On the Radio" and "Last Dance."
